## Delay() function

Delay function calls by a specified amount of time.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function Delay(ms?: number): (target: any, key: string, desc: TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>) => void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  ms | <code>number</code> | The milliseconds to delay calls by. |

<b>Returns:</b>

`(target: any, key: string, desc: TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>) => void`

## Remarks

If you want to delay by one ms, a browser frame or a vue tick, look into [NextMs()](./vue-extra-decorators.nextms.md)<!-- -->, [NextFrame()](./vue-extra-decorators.nextframe.md) or [NextTick()](./vue-extra-decorators.nexttick.md) instead.

## Example


```TS
  @Delay(500)
  delayed() {
    // Executed 500 ms after invocation
  }

```
Call limiting decorators: [Debounce()](./vue-extra-decorators.debounce.md) [Debuffer()](./vue-extra-decorators.debuffer.md) [LimitToFrames()](./vue-extra-decorators.limittoframes.md)

Delaying decorators: [Delay()](./vue-extra-decorators.delay.md) [NextFrame()](./vue-extra-decorators.nextframe.md) [NextTick()](./vue-extra-decorators.nexttick.md) [NextMs()](./vue-extra-decorators.nextms.md)

Interval decorators: [Every()](./vue-extra-decorators.every.md) [EveryFrame()](./vue-extra-decorators.everyframe.md)
